content: topic: what is scoping in concepts of programming language | description: Scoping in programming languages refers to the context within which a variable is defined, declared, or referenced. It determines how long a variable exists in memory and its visibility to other parts of the program.  In Python, for instance, variables assigned with `x = 5` have a scope that extends beyond their declaration line. Later assignments like `y = x + 3` retain the value because Python creates new objects each time. This scoping is maintained even outside the initial assignment if vari | keywords: what is scoping in concepts of programming language

content: topic: what is the ralationn between  pressuare and force | description: Pressure and force are closely related concepts in physics. This relationship can be expressed as:  \[ \text{Pressure} = \frac{\text{Force}}{\text{Area}} \]  When you apply more force to an object with a small area, the pressure increases significantly because the same amount of force is spread over a tiny surface. topic: what is vector in terms of physics | description: Vectors in physics are essential for describing quantities that have both direction and magnitude. They can be thought of as arrows representing movement or force, with the length corresponding to magnitude and direction indicating how far and in which path something moved. For example, if a person pushes a box in one direction with a force, vectors show this push's strength (magnitude) and direction. content: topic: what is array in cs | description: In computer science, an array is like a container that holds multiple items in a structured way. Imagine organizing your favorite snacks on a plate; each snack is an element of the array. Arrays have a fixed size, meaning you can only add so many elements before needing to go back or forth (like scrolling through a list). They're great for holding various data types and making it easy to access any item by its position, like searching for your favorite snack quickly.
